There is a potential for regression in this logic. A previous JWT that included an "amr" claim could have been accepted prior to these changes and it will now be rejected.
Please review if the intention is to make the amr claim optional if the jwtConsumer has not been configured with a list of AMRs to validate.

@chunlongliang-ibm This is a default behavior change. Is this what was intended?

This is a default behavior change and cannot be merged in as coded. A previous JWT that included an "amr" claim could have been accepted prior to these changes and it will now be rejected even when a consumer has not been configured with amrValues. Please ensure that a JWT that contains an amr claim is not rejected when amrValues is not configured.
